wikipedia_page.main: Michael John Dunlop (born 5 November 1982) is a Scottish footballer who is currently Player/Assistant Manager at Broomhill. Dunlop has previously played for Ayr United, Queen's Park, Dumbarton, Alloa Athletic, Brechin City, Stranraer, Albion Rovers, Stenhousemuir, Peterhead, Hurlford United and Rossvale.

link_mentions.page: PFA Scotland Team of the Year

response: On 10 May 2016, Kader joined up with former Forfar manager Dick Campbell, being one of four players to sign for Scottish League Two team Arbroath, alongside his Forfar teammates Michael Dunlop and Gavin Malin. The team won promotion at the end of the season as League Two champions.
Michael Dunlop (born 1989) is a Northern Irish motorcycle racer.
Michael Dunlop may also refer to:
* Michael Dunlop (footballer, born 1957), Scottish football forward
* Michael Dunlop (footballer, born 1982), Scottish football defender
